comments:
This course is an introduction to processes and forces that form the surface and the interior of the Earth. Topics include changes in climate, the history of life, as well as Earth's resources and their uses.

Many students found this course to be “spectacular” and “exceptional,” and reported “learning so much.”

Students felt that Professor Omar was “very knowledgeable,” as well as “very good at keeping students interested.” Students described him as “funny,” “passionate,” and “always willing to help.” One reviewer, however, felt that his powerpoints were “sometimes unclear.”

There are three multiple-choice exams throughout the course. Only one student commented on the difficulty of these exams and he felt that the exams were “extremely difficult” and required knowing “a very large amount of information.”

*8 respondents.
